I know most of these are actual Japanese ghost stories but I wanna know the one about the two brothers and the white silhouettes. The grandpa obviously knew what was out there, and then when the family goes and finds them with all the impaled heads around they ask "What did you see?!". I could understand them not seeing the women at night but wouldn't they see the heads when they found the brothers in the morning and take that as a hint or something??

The ending with the "kill it with fire" face on hasshaku is because he became an adult. Hasshaku's whole thing is with young boys. When a young boy looks a hasshaku's face they see the kind and loving face as to lull them in to a feeling of warmth and safety, then for the rest of their life they long for that feeling again. And when they are older they end up returning to her by themselves and see demon face before presumably getting killed.                  (I hope that this is readable and understandable.)

So I just finished watching the animation for this- Hachishaku Hachiwa Keraku Meguri Igyou Kaikitan- The Animation 1 & 2..and, aside from 1 or 2 of the side stories, have to say this is strangely one of the sweetest pieces Ive ever read. Unless Im just interpreting it completely wrong, the cab driver seems to be the ghost the guy is looking for (at least thats how the anime seems to present it) and he cares for her whether he lives or dies because of it. I mean think about it..throughout his life, shes been a source of comfort, indescribable pleasure and warmth for him so..why wouldnt he fall for her? Perhaps she is indeed an administrator of death, but in his case, something else happens instead...he ends up falling in love with her. Eh...maybe its just my want of a happy ending but..imma apply the happily ever after tag to this one. Made me smile! (>_<)/
